Description: Ostracon (?), large section of the upper-body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel (perhaps from the same vessel as 70811) with base of one handle surviving, the interior is covered with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of red-painted Coptic text, writ large.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394883) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394883)
